title: ASI Signs Phase A Study Contract for INNOVATOR CubeSat Mission
summary:
The Italian Space Agency ASI has signed a contract with an industrial team to begin the Phase A study for its INNOVATOR CubeSat mission that will study gravitational and atmospheric science. The INNOVATOR (INtersatellite liNk fOr graVity and ATmOspheRic science) mission will be carried out by a Temporary Business Grouping (TBG) led by Distretto Tecnologico […]
The post ASI Signs Phase A Study Contract for INNOVATOR CubeSat Mission appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA IG Skeptical of Major SLS Cost Savings From Services Contract
summary: NASA’s Office of Inspector General is skeptical that NASA will achieve significant cost savings by shifting procurement of future Space Launch System rockets to a commercial services contract. In a […]

title: NASA, SpaceX set to launch Psyche mission to metallic asteroid
summary: NASA and SpaceX teams are set to launch the agency’s Psyche mission to metallic asteroid 16 Psyche from Florida on Friday, Oct. 13. Psyche will launch atop a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at the Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida. Launch is currently scheduled for 10:19 AM EDT (14:19 UTC). Current weather forecasts from the 45th Weather Squadron predict a 40% chance for favorable weather at liftoff. Should the launch be scrubbed due to weather, backup launch opportunities are available throughout the following days. Psyche’s launch window lasts from Oct. 5 to Oct. 25.

title: Shipping giant Maersk to add SpaceX’s Starlink internet to more than 330 ships by early next year
summary: Danish logistics giant Maersk is adding SpaceX’s Starlink to more than 330 container ships, the companies announced Thursday.

title: Investing in Space: A reality check on SPAC frenzy revenue projections
summary: We’re now at least two years on from when a slew of space companies went public during the SPAC frenzy, and, look, none of them look great.

title: Startup GuardianSat gets research grant for satellite self-defense technology
summary: GuardianSat won a grant from the National Science Foundation’s America’s Seed Fund to advance the company’s technology designed to protect satellites from collisions with debris objects in space.
